docs.snippet: LEAD: Organizers of the World Cup would not have minded a final between West Germany and the Netherlands. Franz Beckenbauer, the coach of West Germany, does not mind having that matchup in the second round.

headline.main: West Germans to Meet Dutch in 2d Round

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Kathryn Patricia Mai Wood, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Douglas Wood of Darien, Conn., was married there yesterday to George Vaz-Ferreira, the son of Prof. and Mrs. Raul Vaz-Ferreira of Montevideo, Uruguay. The Rev. Edward J. Howley officiated at St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Azeglio Vicini kept tinkering with the lineup tonight with immediate and gratifying results for the host country as Italy beat Uruguay, 2-0, to advance to the quarterfinals of the World Cup.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Mollie Moon, the founder and full-time volunteer president of the National Urban League Guild, died on Sunday at her home in Long Island City, Queens. Her death, at the age of 82, apparently resulted from a heart attack, a family spokesman...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Mollie Moon, the founder and full-time volunteer president of the National Urban League Guild, died on Sunday at her home in Long Island City, Queens. Her death, at the age of 82, apparently resulted from a heart attack, a family spokesman said.

headline.main: Mollie Moon, 82, Founding Head Of the Urban League Guild, Dies

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Italian police rounded up 246 English soccer fans and expelled them from the country today after riots shook this seaside resort. The fans were sent to London on an airliner chartered by the Italian Government.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The currencies and economies of the two Germanys become one today, solidifying the German role as leader of a bloc of European states that are themselves rushing toward economic union and a closer political federation. And next week, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The currencies and economies of the two Germanys become one today, solidifying the German role as leader of a bloc of European states that are themselves rushing toward economic union and a closer political federation. And next week, the leaders of the seven strongest industrial democracies - the United States, Japan, Germany, France, Britain, Italy and Canada - gather in Houston for an economic summit meeting to survey the problems and opportunities of a world changed in subtle and not-so-subtle ways.

headline.main: Triple Play;   The Rich Nations Get Richer. And Then?
